Subjective: Fatigue for 2 months. Possibly superficial sleep. No clear cause or acute onset. Can still do sports and work, but with less enthusiasm. No recent illness or stressors. Social: Lives with wife, no smoking/alcohol. ICE (Concern): Worried about underlying condition, possibly rheumatism.
Objective: BP: 110/60. HR: 40-60. Lungs: clear. Abdomen: normal bowel sounds, no tenderness. Back: some tenderness in lower back, but no clear abnormalities. Musculoskeletal: no joint pain or swelling.
Assessment: Chronic fatigue of unknown cause. Ruled out: heart and lung issues, anemia (pending blood test), rheumatoid arthritis (pending blood test).
Plan: 1. Blood tests: anemia, thyroid function, inflammation. 2. Follow-up phone appointment in 2 days to discuss results. 3. Advice: continue with normal activities, monitor fatigue and report any changes.
